Comment: They can also be placed prenominally (wakˇh´aN-wiˇch´aˇsa kiN ‘the holy (type of) man’), but this construction involves compounding, unlikethe postnominal one.
The definite article is also commonly followed by an additional demonstrative. Interally verbal stems show morphological changes accordingly.
The head noun must be post-modified by one of the definite articles (kiŋ or k’uŋ) by a quantifier, partitive or additive particle. See section 3.5 in Ulrich (2018) for further clarification.
No stacking possible because lkt is consistently left-branching
